title: Short-Intensive Simulation-Based Electronics Engineering Lab Education Program (Large-Scale)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic electronics theory and circuit analysis knowledge
context.additional_context: Blended learning course conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, aiming to cultivate practical skills while minimizing physical experiments through virtual lab simulations

learning_goals: Students can explain operational principles through electronic circuit design and analysis simulations
Learners can independently perform at least three electronic experiments (e.g., RC circuits, OP-AMP amplifiers) using mobile-based simulation tools

Within 1 week, learners can write a physics experiment report (e.g., free-fall motion analysis) following provided guidelines and demonstrate report-writing proficiency equivalent to physical experiments by achieving ≥4 points (on a 5-point scale) in ≥4 of the 5 rubric criteria (clarity of purpose, methodological accuracy, data analysis, conclusion validity, format compliance).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
